intro: Alsinopsis californica, commonly known as the California alsin, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from purple to pink. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Alsinopsis californica is often found in coastal and inland regions, thriving in well-drained soils.
